comment: She gave us a lot of work, and is not very lenient about late work. I barely ended with a B and some controversial assignments. We had 2-3 assignments a week and the bigger/longer assignments were due Friday when they would open the Sunday prior. Thats also the thing she wouldn't open assignments until the Sunday before so you can't get ahead.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers

comment: This class was okay. This professor was very template oriented, meaning she wanted you to follow templates exactly, no excuses. She can be very rude at times, and not helpful at all to your problems. It was honestly like emailing and talking to a brick wall. Also sometimes she took forever to email back and this class honestly stressed me out.

She is rude in emails, gives vague feedback, and isn't helpful when you reach out. English has always been my strongest subject, but I can't please this professor. I've watched her videos, read her announcements, asked for clarification via email, and visited our university's writing center multiple times, but it does nothing. DO NOT TAKE HER
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Lebron cares about her students, but she is a ruthless grader. I am a strong writer, but this class REALLY stressed me out. She uses the same comments, but she will get on call with you upon request for real feedback. She did give extra credit for this semester because students were struggling. AVOID this professor if possible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: I love writing and have never had an issue in any English class, but I struggled with Professor Lebron. She gave contradictory feedback, wouldn't answer a direct question, copied and pasted feedback from other people's papers into my emails, had no clear grading criteria, and was rude in her emails. Overall, a very frustrating class.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: It is very discussion board heavy and the responses are a little excessive but it is not difficult at all. All of the essays I have done multiple times in high school so they were not difficult to do and she gave a lot of time, however her feedback is unhelpful but she is not a tough grader so I would not stress as long as you do the work.
rating_tags: Online Savvy

comment: Don't take her. Had emails ignored, asked questions, asked to meet in person and teams, got falsely accused of AI, her videos have barely any sound, extremely rude over email, your efforts will go in vain. Take a teacher who cares. I asked a second English Comp. teacher to help with my assignment and when I turned it into Lebron after, I failed. ??
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This class is a struggle. Very high workload, lots and lots of writing and overall, just really stressful. The professor is also hard to get in touch with and has poor time management. She has been behind on grading all semester and is very condescending/ rude in her feedback. I would not recommend this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: The only thing that made this class hard was her rude and unhelpful emails. She takes FOREVER to grade and provides vague and rude feedback. She provides barely audible lectures to listen to. This class is very discussion Board heavy, which can be annoying, but it's fine. It's not a bad class; the teacher just makes it bad.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Professor is very vague. Took her for spring 2025. Her responses are rude; "Have you've read the video?" "I'm not going to tell you again" "i've told you many times". Her lecture videos are barely audible and have background noise so you need a sound booster extension.  She grades and give feedback late and there's no in person help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: DO NOT get this teacher. I had to rewrite an entire essay on a cruise because she thought I did and I'm telling you guys truthfully that I did not. She does not grade any of the papers until the last week of class and takes forever to respond. She also has a tough voice to hear in the lectures and she is very monotoned.
As the semester goes on you will get three assignments a week which all take a while. She was fine but took a while to grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Lebron is an understanding teacher, but she does get a bit upset when students don't understand instructions. She responds to emails within the week, but sometimes she might not even answer the specific answer you're asking. Usually 2-3 assignments a week and no tests, just essays. She grades pretty tough but overall an average teacher :)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: Please take her. She is very kind and understanding. Sometimes in emails she can sound a little mean but if you really have a problem then schedule a teams meeting with her to clear things up. She has a lot of students emailing her and submitting new assignments everyday so try and be patient because she tries her best. She is on the students side.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She assigns about 4 assignments a week that take hours and grades very harshly with no clear rubric.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She has a lot of workload, and in the middle of the semester, it is up to 3-4 writing assignments a week. If you are up for the workload, this is a easy class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: This class has a lot of assignments and the whole class is building up to a final paper. Tamara Lebron is an amazing teacher. She tries to make everything as simple and as easy as possible. She wants everyone to pass her class and even gives extra credit at the end of the semester. She will even give you an extension if you ask nicely.
rating_tags: Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: I think she's very knowledgeable and I can tell she legitimately grades all her students papers but it's VERY strict. Like you may fail your first essay strict. It's pretty annoying how she practically expects you to be a professional writer in every essay, but she's pretty lenient when it comes to late work and but she grades extremely harsh.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Caring

comment: With all do respect, DO NOT PICK HER. I had a lot of trouble with getting good feedback from her via email bec she copy and pastes her other comments from other people to your own. All low stakes are free 100, but she grades heavy on papers. I am not going to lie she did not walk us though how to even do the papers either. please take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's literally annoying, does way too much, not much help at all, always beats around the bush when you ask her question. Do not recommend taking her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: If you want to do an obscene amount of homework (1000-2000 words and multiple reading assignments) every week, then take Professor Lebron. The amount of work she assigns is inconsiderate and unfair. Others taking different professors do not have nearly as high of a workload, so I highly suggest taking literally anyone else.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Lebron was amazing! She was always very helpful. As long as you complete your work on time she will be willing to help. The material I had for this class was really cool too. There are two textbooks.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is very nice but the class has a heavy workload, there is a LOT of writing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Shes nice, but please do yourself a favor and dont take this class. Theres so much writing!! I really wished I did not take this class. She gives 100s yea, but when it comes to actually writing the research paper, things get very frustrating and the amount of work is ridiculous. She expects so much for a class thats only one semester.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Lebron is hard to judge. On one side she was nice and caring but on the other her classes were frustrating. Her explanations were never clear and left students confused, she doesnt believe in grading with a rubric because every paper is different so its hard to get everything she is looking for because you dont know.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: there aren't any tests in this class only discussion posts and 3 major papers. the only thing she really grades that are big are the final drafts of each paper but she gives amazing feedback its hard not to get a good grade. She responds fast and seems to really care about the students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback

comment: If youre willing to write a lot for an easy A, I highly recommend this class. The weekly tasks youre given require minimal effort, as long as you apply whats being taught. There are three major writing assignments, and you get to write three drafts for each, with Professor LeBron offering great feedback for all of them.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--So many papers

comment: She is passionate about writing. She is a very easy grader as long as she sees you put in the effort. She has you submit first and second drafts - so you know what to fix by the time you get to the final drafts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Very kind and easy assignments. She just gives a lot of assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Tamera is an easy grader and you will probably get 100 on most assignments as long as you turn something in but her class is very confusing. She is really bad at explaining things and struggles to get the class engaged. Her D2L page is very cluttered and hard to read. Not a hard class just a confusing and frustrating one.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Lebron is a sweet, soft-spoken woman who cares about her career and students. Although she is a kind soul and expresses a passion for writing, she has difficulty making class helpful or interesting, making attendance useless yet still mandatory. The content of the class is easy and very do-able if you dont get lazy.
rating_tags: Caring

comment: Professor Lebron is very quiet. She is hard to understand sometimes, and does not answer questions well. Class feels like a waste of time. I never feel accomplished after going it is basically an online class. She is really nice and gives 100s though, and is not concerned about word count. It's easy but assignments add up fast sometimes. Boring
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Lebron is a soft-spoken lady, and can kind of get taken advantage of by a class pretty easily. However, she is caring and will work with you in order to help you succeed. Not a tough grader at all, but she gives good feedback and allots multiple drafts before the final one is due.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: I took this class during the summer so the content was very condensed. Might be easier during a full length semester. Her lectures are kind of painful to listen to, and I was surprised by the amount of errors in the instructions since she's an English professor. Easy grader but vague feedback. Felt like lots of busy work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is super soft-spoken and doesn't know how to take control of the class to make it interesting. She'll spend the entire class talking about a reading that half the class didn't do and no one is interested in it. Her layout is confusing but I have gotten a 100 on every assignment cause they aren't hard if you don't overthink them. She's ok.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: She cant answer questions. She gets flustered when students dont understand what shes asking. Her D2L setup is really confusing. She tries to reach out but doesnt ever really do anything helpful. We waste 90 minutes a week doing absolutely nothing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She sends an email almost every day with almost the same exact information on her site. Its confusing which one were supposed to use to find the assignments. The theme of the class she chose is technology. An example of what we did in class was watch a video of a robot. It feels more like a science class than an English class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Professor Lebron is a nice person. She gives quick feedback to your emails and gives you feedback on your drafts to fix them accordingly. She is relatively easy to get in contact with and will give you an extra day to finish an assignment if you are having an emergency. Stay on top of discussion boards and assignment dates for an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Prof. Lebron is nice. She doesn't give any tests & allows you to turn in 2 drafts before the final draft of each essay. Listen & make changes according to her feedback, or else she'll give you a bad grade. As long as you do what she wants, this class is an easy A. When she lectures it is hard to understand her points but it doesn't really matter.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Ms. Lebron is super kind and helpful as well. She mainly makes us write essays or reflections on a article that was presented to us that day. She is truly understanding and will never make things harder for you in her class. She wants us all to succeed and go on to the next level. She makes us read all the time but we have group reflections as well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is AWESOME! Anytime you have a question she's available through email and responds almost immediately. Our class had trouble finding textbooks and she was sweet enough to post copies of the chapters online until we were all able to purchase it. She works hard to make sure you understand and really wants you to succeed. Would take her 100x over.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is quirky but that is better than a class boring. Somewhat daily paragraphs due at the end of class easy grade, and 4-5 papers 4-8 pages depending on the paper() her grading criteria is clear follow it you should be fine. I'm not a good writer but I received A's of most the papers, put in the effort you'll pass ps dont procrastinate
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very easy class. Gives feedback on all your drafts before the final draft. During class, she is very awkward and cannot spit out full sentences when explaining. Your topics are your own choice for every paper but if she does not understand it, kiss your grade goodbye. I would suggest looking for a different teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: If you want to make the worst of your college experience, take her class! Her awkwardness and indecisiveness makes the class "different" to say the least. She does try to be helpful sometimes, but usually is not. Definitely recommend a different professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: If you don't like reading/writing, take her. Reading assignments occasionally but she only takes it serious like the first month. 4 Papers. she grades easy if you put in effort. gives extra credit. She gives easy work in class but you have to come to class to get the grade or you will get zeros. classes are pointless people just be on their phones
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Lebron is by far the easiest English 1101 professor at KSU. Theres ample time between essay due dates. Id highly recommend having her for a hybrid class (once a week). For your rough drafts you get peer reviews from your peers, but she also gives you feedback on what to fix before submitting your final draft. Easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: Don't miss class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She's really awesome! It is a lot of work but nothing you can't handle. She gives you 3 weeks for each paper, 1st week is peer review, 2nd week you turn in one for corrections, and 3rd week is when the final paper is due. I missed some deadlines and she opened the assignments so I could turn them in. She is very helpful and wants you to do well.

She is a great teacher. Papers due in her class are really easy because she gives you 3 weeks to do each one. The 1st and 2nd week you also have to turn in a paper, but they can be barely put together. Every time turned in, she critiques it and tells you what she wants in the paper. Received As on every paper without trying. Recomended highly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: She can come off like a tough grader, but if you defend why you wrote something a certain way she will bump your grade up or tell you a better way to do it. 5 papers semester, 3 weeks revising each paper. Semi-interesting readings with discussion boards you have to do and respond to. Kinda boring, but sweet and understanding. I never used my book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: You can tell she is passionate about writing. Very easy grader as long as she can see effort was made. Be prepared to write a lot for homework and papers. Easy A as long as you do all the work.
Heyyyyy. She's pretty good.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor Lebron is a down to earth teacher who really grades EVERYTHING off of participation. As long as I did the assignment, I got a 100 on it. She even let me make up overdue assignments. It may have been because I would engage with her in class discussions though. So as long as you participate in class and do the work, you will get an EASY A.

Professor Lebron is a nice person! She does not give the best critiques on papers and her lectures are boring. Her papers are redundant and build off of each other. She is a very easy grader, she just does not provide valuable insight on your papers in class. I made A's on all of my papers.

Not  difficult, just kinda dry and uninteresting. She is usually a good grader and gives credit where it is due. She's really laid back, but you can tell that she cares about students' success, BUT expect to do a LOT of writing.
If you struggle writing like I do, she is very helpful in her office hours so go see her if you need it.

Absolutely amazing professor! Ms. Lebron is very helpful and will answer any and all questions you have and will go out of her way to give imput and help on essays. Class was a little boring because people would not talk. Other than that this class was great! Essays are never too hard.

Class was super boring, (my group of classmates just never wanted to contribute, it was a very shy group) the lectures were very repetitive, but she was a pretty easy grader when it came to papers. Optional due dates were a huge plus! Deal with the boring lectures and turn in the papers and you'll get an A!!

Boring class but Professor Lebron has optional due dates for rough drafts. If you choose to submit a rough draft she will E-Mail back it to you with constructive criticism. There are four major essays, you're only allowed two unexcused absences, you're graded on participation, and as long as you do the in class assignments you'll get an A for them.
